channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Louisiana Set To Pass Bill Giving Judges Option To Order Surgical Castration For Sex Offenders
Garland to push back on Trump's 'locked & loaded' FBI claim, deny DOJ control of NY case
item.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland will testify before lawmakers and address claims about the FBI search of former President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago home.

item.title: Hunter Biden's Criminal Trial Testimony Opens With Focus on Phone Messages
item.description: Hunter Biden's criminal trial on gun charges will begin in earnest Tuesday with opening statements and potentially lurid testimony about drug use from his autobiography and phone messages that prosecutors say incriminates the president's son.

item.title: Canadian Senator Speaks in Cringey 'Gen Z' Language As She Proposes to Allow 16-Year-Olds to Vote
Drug addiction becomes common thread amid jury selection in Hunter Biden trial
item.description: The jury in the Hunter Biden trial in Wilmington, Delaware, was selected and seated Monday afternoon ahead of opening statements kicking off on Tuesday.

item.title: AG Garland to House Republicans: 'I Will Not Be Intimidated'
item.description: Attorney General Merrick Garland will take aim Tuesday at Donald Trump's Republican allies in the House, where he will accuse them of peddling false narratives that endanger law enforcement and undermine the Justice Department's integrity.

item.title: Biden Tries to Embarrass Trump on TikTok, Is Quickly Decimated by Harsh Reality
5 things to know about Hunter Biden trial
item.description: Hunter Biden faces 25 years in prison in his Delaware gun crime trial, but it is not the only criminal trial he'll face this year.

item.title: Libertarian Chair Endorses Oliver Just to Stop Biden
item.description: The chair of the Libertarian Party, Angela McArdle, showed a spirited sense of humility Monday after announcing she would support her party's nominee, Chase Oliver, as a means to stop President Joe Biden from being reelected.

item.title: Lawyers, Guns, and Money: Hunter Biden Delaware Trial - Day 1
US v Hunter Biden: Opening statements to begin in first son's federal gun trial after jury seated
item.description: Opening statements are expected to begin in United States v. Hunter Biden on Tuesday morning after a jury of 12 was seated Monday afternoon.

item.title: House Advances Bill on Sanctioning World Court
item.description: The House advanced legislation to sanction the ICC after its pursuit of arrest warrants alleging war crimes against Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defense Minister Yoav Gallant in the Jewish state's military operation against Iranian-backed Hamas terrorists.

item.title: Vulnerable Democrats to Snub Biden Immigration Event
Trump, Biden face tests in final 2024 presidential primaries
item.description: After more than 100 primaries and caucuses, the 2024 presidential nominating season comes to a close this month. Even though they've clinched, both Biden and Trump face tests in the final contests

item.title: Ben Carson to Newsmax: Crazy Rules Affected COVID-19 Treatment Options
item.description: Dr. Ben Carson, former HUD secretary and retired neurosurgeon, voiced strong criticism of the public health response to COVID-19 during an interview with Newsmax on Monday.
